results.title: Report for Colombo
results.brief_description: A report on the Colombo Plan, showing the services and facilities it is offering to the countries of south-east Asia. Shows visits of Indian, Pakistani and Ceylonese students and scientists to Australia; Asian students studying in Australian schools, technical colleges and universities; shipment of food, materials and equipment to south-east Asia.

results.title: Rene Spitz: about his own work
results.creator_credit: Susan Sussman and Parents' Magazine Films
results.brief_description: A professional portrait of Dr. Rene Spitz, paediatrician and psychiatrist, largely based on footage taken on a visit to the Erikson Institute in Chicago, 1969. Dr. Spitz is best known for his work on the effects of emotional deprivation on children.

results.title: Rendezvous with destiny
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: This film strikingly conveys the destitution and despair of the depression of the 1930’s in the U.S. which gave rise to the election of Franklin D. Roosevelt and the “New Deal”. Footage shows dumping of milk to raise prices, children sleeping in the street, people living on the city dump, the march of people to Washington, troops attacking peaceful marchers, the right to organise unions and footage of striking workers at Ford with police firing on strikers. Written by Harold Flender. Narrated by Michael Tolan.

results.title: Remodelling milk
results.brief_description: Australian research into the behaviour of milk proteins during heating and mixing has led to new techniques for processing stable skim-milk powders rich in protein. This powder can be transported relatively cheaply to recombining plants in tropical areas, where it is mixed with anhydrous milk fat and water, with or without sugar, to produce sweetened condensed milk or unsweetened evaporated milk. Traces the recombining techniques from pilot plant to full-scale commercial production.

results.title: The Reluctant delinquent
results.brief_description: Portrays the relationship of delinquency to learning disabilities using the case of Robbie Gamble, who is being held in a maximum security facility for juveniles. After many years of failure in school, he is learning to read in special education classes.

results.title: The Reformation
results.brief_description: Explains the Reformation in terms of the Church, the cultural rebirth brought about by the Renaissance, the emergence of national states and the interpretation of the Scriptures. Special attention is devoted to Luther and the Protestant Reformation in Germany. No other credits available.

results.title: Reflections: Ireland
results.creator_credit: Patrick Carey, John Spencer, Grania O'Shannon and Viscom Productions
results.brief_description: This beautiful atmospheric film shows various aspects of an Irish landscape, which is particularly emphasised by rivers, wind and sea. Interesting use of sounds, eg birds chirping, water flowing and the use of traditional Irish folk music played by Paddy Moloney and the Chieftains.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patrick Carey, John Spencer, Grania O’Shannon and Viscom Productions
